definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: It is fun to play card games with my best friends.
sentences.chinese: 和好朋友打扑克是一件有趣的事情。

sentences.english: I took him for 10 pounds at the poker game.
sentences.chinese: 打扑克时我赢了他10英镑。

sentences.english: I don’t have a lot of free time, but I still played a lot of poker.
sentences.chinese: 不过我还是常常会打扑克。
假设你在和朋友打扑克。

sentences.english: B: Everyone in my family really enjoys playing card games.
sentences.chinese: 我们家每个人都特别喜欢打扑克。

sentences.english: Once a week, they meet to play a game of cards and talk about their lives.
sentences.chinese: 每周一次他们一起打打扑克，话话家常。

sentences.english: In his spare time he likes to cycle, garden and play poker.
sentences.chinese: 在业余时间，他喜欢骑自行车，园艺和打扑克。

sentences.english: She is going to play cards after supper.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭之后，她要去打扑克。

sentences.english: In a bar in Chicago last week these 3 guys invited me to a friendly poker game.
sentences.chinese: 上周在芝加哥的一个酒吧里，有3个人邀我打扑克。

definition: to chatter idly/to gossip/to boast or brag
erhua variant of 聊天[liao2 tian1]
